bug.author: bricemaurin
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
The st.bar_chart() height doesn't seem to be taken into account. The width works well. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
import pandas as pd import numpy as np import streamlit as st
chart_data = pd.DataFrame( np.random.randn(50, 3), columns=["a", "b", "c"])
st.bar_chart(chart_data, width=0, height=800) <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
The height of the chart should be 800 <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
The height doesn't change using this param <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.52.2 Python version: 3.7.3 Using PyEnv 1.2.15 OS version: Mac OS Mojave 10.14.6 Browser version: Chrome 79

comments.comment:
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/bricemaurin>@bricemaurin</denchmark-link> , We're improving and fixing bugs for width/height handling in charts in PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/841>#841</denchmark-link>
Keep an eye on that to see when it's merged and released! Leaving this open until then
